page.title: 05Brightlingsea Trees
page.content: The trees in our town are quite varied they include{Lime,Holly, Birches,Rowan {,Hawthorn}and a few{Oaks.}However, we found that the majority of our mature trees are the broad leaved deciduous type such as{Sycamore}and{Horse {chestnut.}These trees are well established in various areas of the town, with a particularly fine old Horse chestnut in{Victoria Place,}our town centre. Around the old{Manor estate lands we discovered many{Scots {Pines.}Many of our{Elms}have recently been victims of{Dutch Elm}disease.An unusual tree to be found here is the {Tasmanian Gum (Eucalyptus}),these owe their presence to{John Bateman}who lived here in the late 1800's. His pastime was growing trees and he imported the seeds and then planted several woods on his lands.These trees are now an interesting feature.
